metadata.subject: Fwd: Our May conversation - more thoughts

relationships.description: Discussing political strategy and potential third-party presidential candidates

analysis.purpose: To propose and analyze the feasibility of a third-party presidential candidate for the 2020 election
analysis.significance: Shows strategic political thinking about disrupting the two-party system during a period of high political polarization

notable_quotes: "The Fall elections are shaping up to be a referendum on the most divisive American President in memory."
"We need to build a back-up plan in the event the system fails again."
"The ideal candidate for a new third party is someone who is widely perceived to be that rare combination of both good and great."

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found. Document discusses political strategy openly.

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed. Document contains political analysis and strategy discussion.

details: References to media coverage of politics
Mentions Stephen Colbert and Saturday Night Live writers potentially being involved in campaign content

public_knowledge.context: Internal political strategy discussion that would be of significant media interest given Jeffrey Epstein's notoriety and the political content

analysis.summary: Jeffrey Epstein emails political strategist BS Stern with a detailed analysis proposing a third-party presidential candidate for the 2020 election, outlining five specific characteristics for an ideal candidate and discussing strategies to disrupt the two-party system amid high political polarization.
